definition: The White Haired Girl (1950), one of the first PRC films

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])

sentences.english: One well-known Chinese ballet is called "The White-haired Girl".
sentences.chinese: 中國一個最著名的芭蕾舞叫“白毛女”。

sentences.english: The white-haired girl was named Xi'er.
She played Xi'er in The White-Haired Girl.
She played the part of the White-haired Girl.
sentences.chinese: 中國一個著名的芭蕾舞叫“白毛女”。

sentences.english: If I were "White-hair Lady" in modern times, absolutely l wouldn't marry "Huang Shiren".
sentences.chinese: 如果我是當代白毛女，我是絕對不會嫁給黃世仁的。

sentences.english: The actor who acted Xi'er in the opera Baimaonv is my father.
sentences.chinese: 歌劇“白毛女”中的扮演喜兒的是我父親。

sentences.english: The white-haired girl's story is one of the saddest.
sentences.chinese: 白毛女的遭遇可算是最悲慘的。
